content.description: Start out at 5.10 dirtier climbing past one bolt, then easier climbing past a gold knifeblade and one more bolt. Then up an awesome face with 2 5.12ish cruxes, one midway, then one at the last moves.
content.protection: 7 bolts and 1 new piton. Fixed biner for lower-off. 110â€™. WATCH YOUR ROPE! Use a 70m
content.location: Wander up to a belay on a grassy ledge just right 10' of Dreadlock Holiday. You are looking for the red slings just 8' below the top of the wall. WATCH YOUR ROPE! It does make it though.

content.description:
Start at the same tree of "

La Nueva Esperanza

" and head straight up the 2 bolted slab at about 5.7 then arive at an optional belay or continue up the mixed headwall at about 5.9 to a runout easy slab then up the awesome, vertical face plugging in gear through the crux of .11b.
content.protection: This route has 4 bolts and one fixed nut at the begining of the crux headwall at the top. This route requires a standard rack and set of nuts.
content.location:
Wander up to the tree at the start of "

La Nueva Esperanza

", then follow the line of bolts up towards the black headwall above.  You also have to rappel twice or bring a tag line!!! Quick links are at the anchors.

climbs.name: UB 31
climbs.fa: T. Perkins, J. Kennedy, B. Sharp

content.description:
A kinda hard and spooky start stays right of steep corner and leads to the 1st crux (about bolt 3). Pull with much faith onto the ramp and begin trending left to big rest. Really fun & steep (cruxy and pumpy for 20'-30'!) climbing leads to a rest before a final mini roof (3rd crux) and a great slab exit!

Although very well bolted and never actually run out, the climb sure "feels" spicy!
content.protection: 9 bolts (bring a couple extendo draws).  Shuts.
content.location: This is in the center of Jimmy Cliff pinballing between the top to bottom black streaks.

content.description: Fourth and Goal is a short and steep sport route on the far left end of Jimmy Cliff that climbs the arete.
content.location: It is on the far left end of Jimmy Cliff, behind a tall pine tree.

content.description:
Right 20 feet of

UB 31

. Climb up a easy fixed rope to a tree at the right edge of the slab at the bottom of the wall, up at 5.6 for 40 ft., then up twin seams at 5.10+ for 15 ft., then leave the right edge/arete of wall onto beautiful, golden, finger cracks at 5.12c/d (grade based on a kneebar, otherwise considerably harder!).
content.protection: 1-#3 cam, 1-#2 cam, 1-#0.5 cam, 1 yellow micro cam, 2 blue TCU, 3 yellow TCU, 1 purple TCU, knee pad! there is a fixed nut in the crux now.
content.location:
Right 20 feet of

UB 31

.11c. Walk up and right through grassy area to a tree at start/dirt stance. Fixed biners/anchor. Watch your rope !!! it's a close one. A 60m does NOT make it, 6-8' short!!!

content.description: A deceptively easy start leads to a deceptively tricky and hard-to-read finish.  Aptly named for the delivery that's bound to be sent when you get suckered into the obvious (yet awfully slopey) holds at the crux.
content.location: This climb is on the short wall located at the left end of Jimmy Cliff.  It climbs the center of the wall, up flakes.
